perturbation.original_text:
Article 116

In the event a dispute arises in connection with the interpretation or implementation of this Contract, the Parties shall attempt in the first instance to resolve such dispute through friendly consultations. If the dispute is not resolved through consultations within sixty (60) days after one Party has served a written notice on the other Party requesting the commencement of consultations, then any Party may refer the dispute to arbitration in Singapore under the auspices of the Singapore International Arbitration Centre in accordance with the rules of that Centre for the time being in force and the provisions of Article 117 of this Contract.
perturbation.changed_text:
Article 3

"Articles of Association" means the Articles of Association of the Joint Venture Company signed by Party A and Party B simultaneously with this Contract in Baoding, People's Republic of China. In the event a dispute arises in connection with the interpretation or implementation of this Contract, the Parties shall attempt in the first instance to resolve such dispute through friendly consultations. If the dispute is not resolved through consultations within sixty (60) days after one Party has served a written notice on the other Party requesting the commencement of consultations, then any Party may refer the dispute to arbitration in Singapore under the auspices of the Singapore International Arbitration Centre in accordance with the rules of that Centre for the time being in force and the provisions of Article 117 of this Contract.
perturbation.explanation: Moving the mandatory arbitration clause from the 'Settlement of Disputes' section to the 'Definitions' section makes it less discoverable and harder to enforce. Arbitration clauses are typically expected in dispute resolution sections, and placing it elsewhere creates a structural flaw.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Law of the People's Republic of China on Arbitration

perturbation.original_text:
Article 76

Matters relating to the recruitment, wages, insurance, welfare, dismissal of the staff and workers of the Joint Venture Company shall be handled in accordance with the LABOR LAW OF THE PEOPLE'S REPUBLIC OF CHINA and the REGULATIONS OF THE PEOPLE'S REPUBLIC OF CHINA ON LABOR MANAGEMENT IN FOREIGN INVESTMENT ENTERPRISES and related PRC regulations. The Joint Venture Company's internal labor policies shall be established pursuant to relevant PRC laws and regulations, and approved by the Board of Directors.
perturbation.changed_text:
Article 120

To the extent permitted by Chinese law, failure or delay on the part of any Party hereto to exercise a right under this Contract and the Appendices hereto shall not operate as a waiver thereof; nor shall any single or partial exercise of a right preclude any other future exercise thereof. Matters relating to the recruitment, wages, insurance, welfare, dismissal of the staff and workers of the Joint Venture Company shall be handled in accordance with the LABOR LAW OF THE PEOPLE'S REPUBLIC OF CHINA and the REGULATIONS OF THE PEOPLE'S REPUBLIC OF CHINA ON LABOR MANAGEMENT IN FOREIGN INVESTMENT ENTERPRISES and related PRC regulations. The Joint Venture Company's internal labor policies shall be established pursuant to relevant PRC laws and regulations, and approved by the Board of Directors.
perturbation.explanation: Moving the disclosure about labor law compliance to the 'Miscellaneous Provisions' section makes it less noticeable and harder to enforce. Labor-related disclosures are normally found in sections related to labor management, and placing it elsewhere creates a structural flaw.
perturbation.contradicted_law: LABOR LAW OF THE PEOPLE'S REPUBLIC OF CHINA

perturbation.original_text:
Article 93

The Joint Venture Company shall pay all taxes and duties required under the national and local laws and regulations of China. The Joint Venture Company's Chinese and expatriate personnel shall pay individual income tax in accordance with the INDIVIDUAL INCOME TAX LAW OF THE PEOPLE'S REPUBLIC OF CHINA.

Article 27

The purpose of the Joint Venture Company is to use advanced technology and scientific management techniques to produce and sell the Joint Venture Products, to improve the quality and increase the value and competitiveness of such products, to develop and introduce new products and to obtain satisfactory economic benefits for the Parties.
